sites.name: Český Krumlov Castle
sites.description: One of the largest castle complexes in Central Europe, this 13th-century castle features beautiful baroque gardens, the unique baroque theatre, and stunning views over the medieval town. A UNESCO World Heritage site.
sites.seasonal_notes: Castle gardens are most beautiful in summer; winter offers fewer crowds and atmospheric snow-covered views.
sites.booking_tips: Book guided tours online in advance, especially for the baroque theatre. Combined tickets offer better value.

sites.name: Historic Center of Český Krumlov
sites.description: Perfectly preserved medieval town center with winding cobblestone streets, Renaissance and baroque buildings, and the meandering Vltava River. UNESCO World Heritage site since 1992.
sites.seasonal_notes: Beautiful year-round; Christmas markets in winter; outdoor dining in summer.
sites.booking_tips: Free to explore. Consider a guided walking tour to learn about the town's history.

sites.name: Egon Schiele Art Centrum
sites.description: Art museum dedicated to Austrian expressionist painter Egon Schiele, who lived in Český Krumlov. Features permanent collection of his works plus rotating contemporary exhibitions.
sites.seasonal_notes: Great indoor activity year-round; special exhibitions change seasonally.
sites.booking_tips: No advance booking usually required. Check for special exhibitions.

sites.name: Museum Fotoatelier Seidel
sites.description: Fascinating photography museum in the original studio of Josef Seidel, documenting life in Český Krumlov from 1905-1945. Original darkroom and equipment preserved.
sites.seasonal_notes: Perfect indoor activity for rainy days; atmospheric in all seasons.
sites.booking_tips: Guided tours available in multiple languages. Book ahead for English tours.

sites.name: Vltava River Rafting
sites.description: Scenic canoe or raft trips along the Vltava River, offering unique views of the castle and town from the water. Various routes from 1-3 hours available.
sites.seasonal_notes: Available April-October; best conditions in late spring and summer.
sites.booking_tips: Book with local operators. Equipment and basic instruction included.

sites.name: Church of St. Vitus
sites.description: Gothic church dating from 1439 with beautiful frescoes and the tomb of the Rosenberg family. Notable for its unique asymmetrical towers and baroque altar.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round; particularly atmospheric during winter months.
sites.booking_tips: Free entry; check opening hours as they vary seasonally.

neighborhoods.name: Historic Center (Inner Town)
neighborhoods.description: The UNESCO World Heritage historic core with winding medieval streets, Renaissance and baroque buildings, centered around the main square (Náměstí Svornosti).
neighborhoods.dining_scene: Traditional Czech restaurants, cafes, and tourist-friendly establishments

neighborhoods.name: Castle District (Latrán)
neighborhoods.description: The area leading up to Český Krumlov Castle, featuring the lower castle courtyards, gardens, and castle-related buildings.

neighborhoods.name: Parkán Area
neighborhoods.description: Residential area along the outer fortifications with gardens, parks, and more modern accommodations. Less touristy with local character.

neighborhoods.name: Vltava Riverfront
neighborhoods.description: The area along the meandering Vltava River with scenic walks, rafting departure points, and beautiful views of the castle and town.
neighborhoods.dining_scene: Seasonal riverside cafes and beer gardens

neighborhoods.name: New Town (Nové Město)
neighborhoods.description: The more modern part of town across the river, with practical services, accommodations, and a less touristy atmosphere.

restaurants.name: Restaurant Don Julius
restaurants.description: Elegant restaurant in a historic Renaissance building offering refined Czech cuisine with modern presentation and excellent local wines.

restaurants.name: Krčma v Šatlavské
restaurants.description: Atmospheric medieval tavern with rustic décor, traditional Czech fare, and local beers. Popular with both locals and tourists.

restaurants.name: Restaurant Villa Concordia
restaurants.description: Refined dining in a beautiful Art Nouveau villa with river views. International cuisine with Czech influences.

restaurants.name: Laibon
restaurants.description: Cozy vegetarian restaurant with creative dishes, healthy options, and relaxed atmosphere. Great for lighter meals.

cafes.name: Café Central
cafes.description: Historic café in the town center with traditional coffee, cakes, and beautiful views of the main square.

cafes.name: Chocolaterie & Café
cafes.description: Charming café specializing in handmade chocolates, artisanal coffee, and sweet treats.

cafes.name: Café Museum
cafes.description: Small café near the Egon Schiele Art Centre with excellent coffee and quiet atmosphere for relaxing.

local_specialties.description: Fresh trout from the Vltava River, typically grilled or baked with herbs and served with local vegetables.
Regional specialty made with local game, slow-cooked with onions, paprika, and served with bread dumplings.
Roasted duck prepared in the traditional style of the noble Rosenberg family, often with red cabbage and dumplings.
Local dessert cake with layers of chocolate, nuts, and cream, created specially for the town.

drinks.name: South Bohemian Beer
drinks.description: Local beers from the South Bohemian region including Budweiser Budvar from nearby České Budějovice.

drinks.name: Moravian Wine
drinks.description: Quality wines from the nearby Moravian wine region, particularly whites like Riesling and Grüner Veltliner.

drinks.name: Medovina
drinks.description: Traditional Czech honey wine, often served warm with spices, especially popular during winter months.

destinations.whyGo: Capital city with stunning architecture, rich history, and vibrant cultural scene.
Czech Republic's second largest city with modernist architecture and university atmosphere.
Cultural capital of Austria with modern arts scene and beautiful Danube setting.
Mozart's birthplace with baroque architecture and Alpine beauty.
Imperial capital with magnificent palaces, world-class museums, and coffee culture.
Charming regional capital and home of original Budweiser beer, with beautiful main square.
UNESCO World Heritage old town with innovative architecture and lively student atmosphere.

spring.description: Traditional Easter markets in the main square featuring local crafts, painted eggs, and regional specialties.
The baroque castle gardens reopen after winter with beautiful spring flowers and perfect weather for exploring.
Rafting and canoeing season starts on the Vltava River with ideal weather conditions and scenic routes.

summer.description: World-renowned classical music festival featuring performances in historic venues including the castle's baroque theatre.
Medieval festival celebrating the town's history with period costumes, crafts, tournaments, and traditional entertainment.
Traditional summer solstice celebration with bonfires, folk music, and festivities along the river.
Summer theatre performances in the rotating auditorium and other outdoor venues throughout the town.

autumn.description: Celebration of the local wine harvest with wine tastings, traditional music, and seasonal foods.
Guided photography tours taking advantage of beautiful fall colors reflecting in the Vltava River.
Local tradition of mushroom foraging in the surrounding Bohemian Forest with guided tours available.

winter.description: Intimate Christmas markets in the main square with handmade crafts, mulled wine, and traditional Czech holiday treats.
Spectacular fireworks display over the illuminated castle and historic town center.
Special winter tours of the castle with fewer crowds and atmospheric snow-covered courtyards.
Religious and cultural celebrations marking the end of the Christmas season with local traditions.

ranges.notes: Peaceful winter atmosphere with snow-covered medieval streets, very cold (-4 to 1°C), minimal crowds, many seasonal closures. Perfect for photographers seeking atmospheric winter shots.
recommendations: Visit early morning for best light

ranges.notes: Coldest month with frequent snow, very peaceful, ideal for indoor attractions (-3 to 2°C). Valentine's Day brings romantic atmosphere to the medieval town.
Spring transition, variable weather, longer days, pre-season tranquility (1 to 8°C). Early spring brings first signs of life to the medieval town.
Pleasant spring weather, castle gardens reopen, Easter celebrations (6 to 15°C). Beautiful spring blossoms and Easter markets bring life to the town.
Perfect spring weather, all attractions open, ideal conditions (8 to 18°C). May Day celebrations and perfect weather make this an ideal time to visit.

eventDetails.description: Medieval festival with costumes, music, and traditional crafts

ranges.notes: Peak season begins, Five-Petalled Rose Festival, perfect weather (12 to 23°C). The most famous festival brings the medieval town to life.

eventDetails.description: Classical music performances in historic venues

ranges.notes: Peak season, International Music Festival, can be hot (15 to 25°C). Music fills the medieval streets with classical performances.
Continued peak season, warm weather, extended festival events (14 to 24°C). Summer continues with perfect conditions for all activities.
Perfect weather, autumn colors begin, harvest festivals (9 to 19°C). Ideal conditions with beautiful autumn scenery and reduced crowds.
Beautiful autumn colors, comfortable weather, harvest season (6 to 14°C). Peak autumn beauty with golden leaves and harvest celebrations.
Cool, gray weather, peaceful atmosphere, off-season pricing (2 to 8°C). Quiet period perfect for cultural exploration and indoor activities.

eventDetails.description: Traditional Christmas markets with local crafts and food

ranges.notes: Christmas markets, winter atmosphere, festive decorations (-2 to 3°C). Magical Christmas atmosphere transforms the medieval town.

specialEvents.description: Medieval festival with costumes and traditional crafts
Classical music performances in historic venues
Traditional Christmas markets with local crafts
